answer:
Shingrix® is recommended for adults 50 years of age or older including those who previously had shingles. Immunization may be considered at least one year after having shingles. The vaccine should not be given to those who currently have shingles. Read more about the shingles vaccines here.
The injected influenza vaccines are inactivated (non live) and there is not a vaccine safety reason to delay the influenza vaccine after having shingles. Discuss your current health and any concerns with your immunizing health care provider. Find an influenza vaccine (flu shot) clinic near you here.
Immunization Nurse
question: I had shingles in Sept.2018 when can I get the shingles shot and also when can I get the flu shot safely.
question_variation_2: flu shot safe before flu shot
